page.title: 11THE CHURCH CONTINUED
page.content: completely altered the appearance of the building and the south side was rebuilt in the classical style by Mr.Gilbert Rodes who died in 1768.A parapet and pinnacles were added to the tower in 1776 at a cost of Â£98.88 which was defrayed by the parish. It has a 13th century arch leading to the bell tower. The tower contains six bells. Two of them have writing on them:1."I Maria am struck and am called the Rose of the World." 2."St.James,Glory to God in the Highest." {The Chancel.}Beneath the High Alter are buried Sir Richard Pype and Sir William Halles. {Church Records.}There is a complete set of church registers dating from 1648,while the list of Rectors of Barlborough is complete.
